reviews.review_msg: Greatest pro ever Didn't review the midterm because of world cup, still  got B, and final was very easy, assignments were hard, but he was so helpful would love to take with him again
hands down for the chillest econ professor in the school
final exam is extremely easy
He is great a professor. Willing to help students. The exams overall are fair. If do all questions provided by him, you are great to go!
Great great prof!!!!!! take his class!!!!
best prof in sfu. He is very nice and very helpful for the assignments.
Very helpful for assignments and exams. True that the midterm was way too long, but he did gave us a short final. Honestly, econ courses are all hard, you can't find any easy grade courses
Coolest econ prof met in sfu, office hours are chill and helpful. The assignments and exams are more than fair.
midterm was amazingly hard and way too long. No one left before exam ended.

This class is hard if you dont read the unreadable notes (his handwriting is hard to understand; he doesnt type out his notes, he projects them instead). The exams are extremely difficult and tests you based on a lot of theories and graphs. The tutorials are not that useful. I wouldnt recommend taking his class unless necessary. BEWARE!

I really enjoyed this class. I love instructors that provide clear and thorough lecture notes, so you can actually focus on their lecture during class, instead of madly scribbling down notes. He followed his notes precisely. He is a great teacher, very clear, no language problems. He is approachable and encourages questions during class.

Not a big fan of econ and graphs, but if you study his notes well and do the practice questions for tutorial then you'll do fine. Lectures were a bit boring, but it's economics...usually not super interesting.

dun bother buying the textbook, his lecture notes are sufficient for the midterm and final exam. doing his assignments will help u prepare for exams. he's a pretty approachable guy and helps students. (lots of ppl ask him Qs during break and he doesnt mind). he sure likes his coke zero tho. take neat notes tho! and use diff color pens for graphs

was better teaching 105 than this class. sometimes goes off on tangents and makes notes about them even though it's totally irrelevant. Did most of my learning out of the textbook. there was confusion about the final and which chapters were covered (not his fault) but kinda ****ed me up :( final was a little brutal but mt was very fair
not very good at explaining content, he basically reiterates the text book and does not explain further. content covered is irrelevant to actual practices in international trade.

His notes are very clear; they made the textbook almost unnecessary (it's being changed next term though). Being on Monday in the fall term, the course had a lot of content left out and too little work to do. I probably would have gotten a better mark with a more regular workload. He didn't offer a practice final exam, so you're on your own there.

easy class just study his notes and past exams; he seem well prepared but when i go to his officehour he doesnt answer any of my question(he say it wouldnt be fair to other students..) he doesnt even giv me more practice questions! and my TA suked too no one understood her in tutorial..
Fantastic prof. notes are clear.
Fantastic prof. He explains the material so well during lecture that you will actually learn, understand AND retain it. Can't ask for more from any lecturer!

Took 105, 301 & 342 with him simply because he is the BEST Econ prof. Take notes, there's a reason why he writes them! Extremely clear on everything. Exams are quite straight forward; if you have studied the notes and made an effort to understand them, you should have NO problem getting a good mark.
skipped so many classes, but still end up w/ a good grade ^^ (but remember to get all the lecture notes from your classmates)
very good prof
Senior lecturer in the Econ dept?  He is the worst lecturer ever.  Perhaps time to retire?
Good Prof. informative note
I've never had another prof go into the depth he does, while still making it so easy to understand. He is an amazing prof.
His note is clear, but too brief...so you should read the textbook...his exam and test are easy
No Comments
Clear Notes!! don't skip!!
excellent professor, very approchable

if u r planning to take his class...make sure u take him as ur TA as well...actually his teaching isnt bad..and he knows his stuff well..but the only thing he lacks is his communicative skills..he teaches as if he is talking to himself and that's why he can teach much better in smaller classes..
only need to stay home study the powerpoint notes and read the text.  no need attend lecture since can't even understand his english.
spends too much time with female students. boring and incompetent
lectures are very unclear, u can't hear him cuz he mumbles. not really worth going to lectures either, he reads the powerpoint from the textbook's website!!

For some unknown reasons, i got an A+ even though i didnt do good on the quizzes/midterm. But i agree that he is a better TA then a professor.  So the boring lectures are optional as long as u r willing to read the txt.
bad lecture, just read out the power point which everyone can get it thru the web site of the text
Dr. Hobdari is a very good instructor. He is always very well prepared and also very helpful when there is a problem.
Good guy, easy to talk to and willing to explain things.  Uses PowerPoint slides from textbook website, so lecture seemed fairly optional.  Frequent quizzes and homework kept me on my toes.
his lectures r unclear coz he mumbles all the time...but actually his teaching isnt bad if u get the chance to know him from being in his tutorial sections...he's a better TA than he is a prof...
he just reads off the powerpoint from the textbook's website. speaks unclearly so no one attends lectures anyway
No Comments

he teaches from the powerpoint that's available on the textbook's website. so pretty much, he reads the notes and TRIES to explain but he's horrible at teaching. u'll be bored out of your mind, plus his accent makes listening even more difficult.
the course was easy compared to other econ courses. But he disappointed me with his grading system. awful.

If he didn't use such an awful online quiz software (which is still easy marks due to retries on assignments), I would've enjoyed his course more. He starts lectures with a little speech relating the course to the real world, but then proceeds to teach straight out of the textbook and leaves the math for the tutorials. Meh.
Forget it with him
Boring lecture, boring but nice prof, useless online assignments, useless tutorials, hard midterm, easy final.
SERIOUSLY THO EVERYONE! DONT TAKE 342 WITH HIM...David Cox is way better and easier!

Easiest econ prof I have ever encountered. He doesn't ask trick questions, doesn't ask in reversed order, and doesn't test the hardest materials from each ch. His lecs are boring and useless, but his tuts are very useful even if not mandatory. Overall hes a highly recommended prof!

I found Nicholas' teaching style inately boring.   His course is very easy, but he teaches exactly from the book, which he has put onto slides, and doesn't cover anything else.   He was also arrogant in correcting a marking error I had, and was not willing to help.  I got an A-, so it was easy, but don't go with him if you want to learn anything.
He is willing to explain the graphs step by step and the final was extremely easy. recommended
extremely great prof in SFU,one of the best prof i have even seen in sfu.i highly recommand you to take his course.
Very nice professor. Easy course if you read his slides.

The prof is actually really caring but he lacks in teaching. He is unable to clearly deliver the conceptual arguments for each chapter. He also makes it more complicated than it has to be. Being an honors student it wasnt tough for me but i agree with other students giving bad reviews.

The online midterm is difficult especially essay-type questions. You only have 10 minutes to read and think and then type the answer. The time constrain is tense and the question is super hard even though I do read the textbook. However, the professor is nice and caring. It will be better if he can give out the answer of the practice midterm.
michael is a wonderful prof! the online lectures may be wordy as someone said but that is the nature of the class. he is caring and listens to his students. I wish more profs were like him!

ECON 342 is not an easy course- as with most 300 level econ courses. Aside from the lectures one also needs to study on their own to fully understand the material. I found Batu's video lecture to be really helpful and his exams are fair. Plus he's very reasonable and cares about his students!
This is the worst econ course I have taken. He is wordy and bad at explaing the lectures. He seperates the vedio lectures into 7 or 8 parts and each vedio is 15 min. This is useless and dumb.
His teaching method is all ppt. If you are not a super genius like Einstein, then you have no way to keep up with him.

He rushed through the material in class and wasn't helpful during office hours. He looked visibly annoyed or angry when I asked him to go over concepts again. Made me feel like it was my problem I was struggling.

Amazing class! The grading criteria were very clear. The lectures were amazing, and he clearly understands the material and conveys it well. He genuinely seems to enjoy teaching, and it shows in his work. The class had super active discussion boards. He's very approachable and is one of the best econ professors I've had throughout my degree!
The course was unnecessarily complicated and the exams were too hard. Not recommended. I also found the professor annoying and weird. He's nice but definitely weird.
Just do his classes and you will know the truth. Also one of the worst graders of all time. Do not recommend at all. 0/10

Most certainly has bias towards students. Has his favourites who he will mark good regardless, others he'll just end up giving what he thinks you deserve rather than the actual assignment. If you talk to him about it, he will just dismiss you.

One of the best professors I've had during my four years at university. I believe those who gave low ratings likely didn't put in the effort themselves. If you're not willing to work hard, you shouldn't expect to pass. He is definitely a fair grader!
Seems like a nice guy but not helpful at all and has some issues. Did not enjoy the course experience.
Not responsive and does not help as much. Professor does not provide proper feedback or even explain his own materials. Harsh grader too.

I had him for ECON342 in his first term ever at SFU (Fall 2024) and could say that he's one of the best Econ instructors I've ever had during my major. His teaching approach was clear, the exam questions may be a little tricky compared to his weekly assignments (done in tutorial) but if you study hard and understand the concepts, you'll do well.
Kevin Laughren is one of the best professors in the economics department. He has a clear approach to the course and encourages active participation in his classes. Definitely recommended!

Hope for a good TA, read his lecture notes a lot. The exam structure is horrendous. His lectures spend way too much time on a bunch of irrelevant math and breezes through the actual models, theories, etc. Overall Id avoid him but if you work super super hard you can do well in the class.

I think alot of his negative reviews are older classes maybe he was a bit more dry back then but taking him in covid times has been pretty good. Pretty caring, answers emails really fast, very fair and very knowledgeable. Tests are sorta hard but if you really understand the theory / do a lot of the reading + extra reading you'll be fine. A+

Super available via email for questions and tries to make the class interesting. There are lots of questions available on his website to practice and if you do them all you'll succeed in the class. Probably one of the most high tech profs when moving online. Wants you to do well but you just need to put in some work for it. Overall great prof!!

He is actually a good professor. He wants the student to ask questions from him. Helpful when you attend the office hour. Does a lot of derivations in the class but noting of that comes in the exams(he just want to make things clear ) the exam only test you the lecture notes knowledge Easier than most the upper level econ
Boring lecture
Actually not hard but like short essays. Read the textbook! his lecture is boring.

USELESS PROF, NEVER REPLY EMAILS AND TEACH USELESS STUFF IN LECTURE...MIDTERM IS EZ BUT FINAL IS A LITTLE BIT MORE DIFFICULT.. TA WAS NOT VERY GOOD AS WELL....AVOID THIS BORING CLASS....BUNCH OF GRAPHS AND SYMBOLS...

The class is easy I cannot understand how anyone can rate the class poorly the prof ?s ok not great he spends way too much time on useless math equations which are useless and are not on the midterm or final. If you just study the practice exams and the uderstand the main models the class is very easy.

I never attended classes after the midterm and ended up with A. All you need is study the course by yourself because his lectures are useless and his notes remind me an Arabic script. His exams are extremely easy for those who understand the main points. I would not take any other class with him as self-studying is not my thing
The most useless and boring class i've ever had. His handwritting is terrible. AVOID

Very useless prof, writes notes as if he has a pen in his mouth, off track easily and unclear "Today we're going to talk about this but you won't need to know this but I'm going to say it anyways", doesn't answer questions clearly or engage the class in any way, 2-hour boring lectures. Exams as described below. Easton - not even once AVOID PLEASE!

5 bad out of 5 bad! bad teaching, bad notes, bad TA, bad exams and bad marking scheme. bad bad bad!! last question in the final worth 1/3 of 50% of your total grades. And it is an open question. You better be a buddy of your TA otherwise you get ugly marks... He makes easy things complicated..and the course super dumb boring

you need to read the textbook in order to understand what he does in class because he is very unclear and he skips a lot of steps when explaining some models. His lecture notes are useless because you wouldn't able to read his terrible handwriting and messy graphs. He himself is the only one who can understand those messy notes. bad TA bad marking

He is a very passionate prof. but he's very bad at explaining things!!! He never stops talking for the whole 2 hours. Also lectures are not too helpful with his terrible handwriting. I guess the only reason he s still in SFU is that his exams are fairly easy. You just need to study the course by yourself.

Easton is one of the more knowledgeable profs I've had. He's also very nice and approachable. If you pay attention, his lectures are actually informative and clear. His exams are fair--no surprises. If you are interested in the course material and put in the effort, you can do well.

He is really knowledgeable and his notes is quite useful for studying this course even though his handwriting is horrible. Find all information and answers from his notes for his sample paper cuz those will be midterm and final's questions :D Good luck.

Easton comes across as a lazy instructor. At this point in his career, he probably doesn't care about anything. Lectures are not that useful. He frequently said, "It's in the textbook" and "I do this very differently from the textbook (stress importance)." His notes are also very unclear and essentially useless.

Lectures are painful. He loves to talk.  Notes during lectures are chicken scratch graphs that are useless. Occasionally posts hand written pdfs. Exams are very tough.  Questions are not clear. Cannot operate technology. Would recommend to wait for David Cox.

Very intellegent and articulate. I found his class enlightening and challenging. The material he tests draws on the textbook heavily, but isn't taken directly from it. You have to actually learn the material and think it through. To do well you need the drive/capacity to understand. Those who don't do well obviously don't.

Read the book before going to lecture, or else it is a waste of time. I rarely ever wrote down notes since he likes to draw messy graphs and write algebra equations a lot. I got burned on the midterm but I still got an A(he forgives the midterm). Seems like a nice guy when you talk to him in person or in his office. Read the book and you'll be fine

Well. He is a good economist. But he doesn't know how to teach. He NEEDS TO TALK to his TAs. Even the TAs dont know how he is gonna mark his partcipation. He has notes. But sorry diagrams arent self explantory, especially for courses like 342.
1. no notes at all, just bunch of ugly diagrams. 2. hard to hear his voice from back row of the lecture hall. 3. His TA are bad as well.
Hes hard ... for god sake
No Comments

The worst Econ prof I had so far. Drew bunch of graphs without any word explanations. Sure, he knows HIS STUFF, but just not a guy that knows how to lecture. I Guess the word is out: His course in spring has the most spaces left for a day class,47. Just avoid this guy if you can.
Not an easy prof, who likes to prove things with math.  Great mind though.
useless lecture notes.....
excellent lecturer - makes complex ideas easier to understand
Very nice professor, also very friendly in giving scores
